Authors:
Subashini Chathumini Jayasiri, Kevin D Hyde, E.B. Gareth
Jones, Ali H BAHKALI
Title:
Gloniales ord. nov., (Dothideomycetes, Ascomycota) and a new
hysteriform dothideomycete, Purpularium murispora gen. et sp. nov. on
scales of pine cones
Abstract:
The family Gloniaceae is represented by the genera Glonium
(plant saprobes) and Cenococcum (ectomycorrhizae). This work adds to the
knowledge of the family, by introducing a new taxon from dead scales of
pine cones collected on the ground in Chiang Mai Province, Thailand.
Analysis of a combined LSU, SSU, RPB2 and TEF1 sequence dataset inferred
the distinct phylogenetic position of the taxon in Gloniaceae and
Purpularium murispora gen. et sp. nov. is introduced to accommodate it.
The genus is characterized by erumpent to superficial, navicular
hysterothecia, with a prominent longitudinal slit, branched
pseudoparaphyses in a gel matrix, with a purple pigmented epithecium,
hyaline to dark brown muriform ascospores and a Psiloglonium
stygium-like asexual morph which is produced in culture. The new taxon
is illustrated and compared with similar genera and a new order is
introduced to accommodate the monotypic family Gloniaceae which now
comprises three genera.
